oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Bean Station monument
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Monument erected by the Daughters of the American Revolution to Bean Station as one of the earliest settlements in Tennessee.

In the 1780's, the sons of William Bean, an early Tennessee settler, established Bean Station as a frontier outpost. In the Civil War, the Battle of Bean's Station occurred in December of 1863, and resulted in forcing Union Soldiers to retreat.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Land settlement
Monuments & memorials; Historic sites; Settlements
